info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued December 31 at 6:03AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE FOREST SERVICE UTAH AVALANCHE CENTER. * WHAT...AVALANCHE WARNING. THE AVALANCHE DANGER IS HIGH. * WHERE...THE BEAR RIVER RANGE OF MOUNTAINS. * WHEN...FROM NOW THROUGH 600 AM NEW YEAR`S DAY. * IMPACTS...TRAVEL IN AVALANCHE TERRAIN IS NOT RECOMMENDED. HEAVY SNOWFALL AND STRONG WIND HAVE CREATED VERY DANGEROUS CONDITIONS. BEING CAUGHT IN ANY AVALANCHE IS LIKELY TO BE UNSURVIVABLE. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... BACKCOUNTRY TRAVELERS SHOULD STAY OFF OF, AND OUT FROM UNDERNEATH, SLOPES STEEPER THAN 30 DEGREES. AVALANCHES MAY RUN LONG DISTANCES AND CAN RUN INTO MATURE FORESTS. CHOOSE CONSERVATIVE TERRAIN. CONSULT WWW.UTAHAVALANCHECENTER.ORG OR CALL 1-888-999-4019 FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION. SIMILAR AVALANCHE DANGER MAY EXIST AT LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE COVERAGE AREA OF THIS OR ANY AVALANCHE CENTER.
